Package model

Class ChessModel

java.lang.Object
java.util.Observable
model.ChessModel
public class ChessModel extends Observable
This class represents the model in the MVC format of the program. It will handle most of the logic behind the game play. Specifically, it will determine which moves are valid/invalid and which player's turn it is. It will be observed by the view (ChessGUIView) and as a result, will notify the GUI to ensure the game is properly displayed to the user.

  • Constructor Details

    • ChessModel

      public ChessModel() throws IOException
      The constructor will initialize a grid and a map of game pieces to track the game progress.
      Throws:
      IOException - throw exception if program fails.

  • Method Details

    • saveGame

      public String saveGame()
      This method will save a game so that it can be accessed later. The game is saved in a Sting. Game pieces are stored and their x,y coords, color, and name are assigned to each piece.
      Returns:
      a String containing info about the status of the game

    • isMyTurn

      public boolean isMyTurn()
      A getter method to determine if is is the player in questions turn to make a move.
      Returns:
      a boolean, true if it is the player's turn, else false

    • flipMyTurn

      public void flipMyTurn()
      A method to swap the current player turn status. If myTurn = true, becomes false. If myTurn = false, becomes true.

    • loadGame

      public void loadGame​(File gameFile, boolean isWhite) throws IOException
      This method will load a previously saved game. The game file is read and the pieces placed on the board and game status is restored.
      Parameters:
      gameFile - a File the contains info about the game status
      Throws:
      IOException - throw exception if file is not found

    • isWhiteTurn

      public boolean isWhiteTurn()
      A getter for the status of the white player's turn, which also indicates the black player's turn. If true, it is white player, if false, black player.
      Returns:
      a boolean indicating the status of the white player's turn

    • setWhiteTurn

      public void setWhiteTurn​(boolean turn)
      This method will set the white player's turn status to true/false. Indicating that it is or is NOT the white player's turn to move.
      Parameters:
      turn - a boolean, set the status of the white player's turn

    • legalFirstClick

      public boolean legalFirstClick​(ChessGUIView.compoundKey coordinates)
      This method will determine if the first click (choose the piece the player wants to move) is legal or not. For example, if it is the white player's turn and the click on a white pawn, return true. If it is the white player's turn and they try to move a black pawn, return false. The type compoundKey stores the x,y coordinates of the player's click. See ChessGUIView for details on compoundKey.
      Parameters:
      coordinates - a compoundKey storing x,y coords
      Returns:
      a boolean, true if legal, else false

    • checkPath

      public boolean checkPath​(ChessGUIView.compoundKey firstClickCoords, ChessGUIView.compoundKey secondClickCoords)
      This method will check to see if the piece in question can make the proposed move or if there are restrictions blocking the path.
      Parameters:
      firstClickCoords - a compoundKey with the x,y coords of the first click
      secondClickCoords - a compoundKey with the x,y coords of the second click
      Returns:
      a boolean, true if move can be made, else false

    • filterQueenMoves

      public Set<List<Integer>> filterQueenMoves​(Set<List<Integer>> possibleMoves, ChessGUIView.compoundKey firstClickCoords)
      This method determines the possible moves that can be made by the Queen.
      Parameters:
      possibleMoves - a Set of Integer Lists of possible moves
      firstClickCoords - a compoundKey of x,y coords for the first click
      Returns:
      an updated Set of Integer Lists of possible moves

    • filterKingMoves

      public void filterKingMoves​(Set<List<Integer>> possibleMoves, ChessGUIView.compoundKey firstClickCoords)
      This method determines the possible moves that can be made by the King. Note: If a king is moving diagonally, we don't need to check their horizontal or vertical move
      Parameters:
      possibleMoves - a Set of Integer Lists of possible moves
      firstClickCoords - a compoundKey of x,y coords for the first click

    • legalSecondMove

      public boolean legalSecondMove​(ChessGUIView.compoundKey firstClickCoords, ChessGUIView.compoundKey secondClickCoords)
      This method will determine if the second attempted move is legal.
      Parameters:
      firstClickCoords - a compoundKey of x,y coords for the first click
      secondClickCoords - a compoundKey of x,y coords for the second click
      Returns:
      a boolean, true if move is legal, else false

    • makeMove

      public boolean makeMove​(ChessGUIView.compoundKey firstClickCoords, ChessGUIView.compoundKey secondClickCoords)
      If both the first and second proposed clicks are deemed valid, make the move.
      Parameters:
      firstClickCoords - a compoundKey storing the coordinates where the player first clicked
      secondClickCoords - a compoundKey storing the coordinates where the player clicked second
      Returns:
      a boolean, true if move is legal, else false

    • networkedMove

      public ChessMoveMessage networkedMove​(ChessGUIView.compoundKey firstClickCoords, ChessGUIView.compoundKey secondClickCoords)
      This method will send the move info for a networked game, which operates differently from the local version. It will check the first and second click coords, then return a MoveMessage which contains info about the attempted moves, the pieces involved, and the game status (see ChessMoveMessage)
      Parameters:
      firstClickCoords - a compoundKey with x,y coords of first click
      secondClickCoords - a compoundKey with x,y coords of second click
      Returns:
      a ChessMoveMessage with info about the attempted move

    • getWhiteTurn

      public boolean getWhiteTurn()
      A getter method for the status of the white player's turn.
      Returns:
      a boolean, true if it is white's turn, else false

    • getPieceString

      public String getPieceString​(int i, int j)
      Get the piece (represented by a string) at the given coordinates.
      Parameters:
      i - an int, x coordinate
      j - an int, y coordinate
      Returns:
      a String representing the game piece

    • getValidMoves

      public Set<ChessGUIView.compoundKey> getValidMoves​(ChessGUIView.compoundKey firstClick)
      Get a Set of compoundKeys representing valid moves that can be made from the x,y coords of the first click.
      Parameters:
      firstClick - a compoundKey, x,y coords of first click
      Returns:
      a Set of compoundKeys with valid moves

      public List<List<Piece>> getBoardGrid()
